fields.physical_description:
Resist and block printed machine woven cotton; two  pieces of fabric printed and then sewn together.  Backed with white cotton. There is one incomplete selvedge. 
Colours: red, blue, yellow faded to grey, mauve.

The central panel with an off-white ground contains a roundel 36 cm in diameter with a multi-petalled red flower head and a 15-pointed blue star leading to alternate motifs consisting of a vase with a flowering plant or a blue cypress tree and a heart-shaped form.  A narrow blue  border frames this composition and in turn is surrounded by blue ogival pendants containing small floral motifs. There are two types of floral meander with a blue stem and exotic blossoms, predominantly red, framed a narrow band edged in blue containing lozenges with small floral motifs.  This leads into a wider band bearing a blue stem meander and large and small flower heads similar to those in the main field.
In the corners is a small diagonal vase and floral spray with a cypress tree. This  frame continues with a yellow ground band containing a flower head; there are five versions of this flower head. [referred to as band a].
There are two long side panels with a blue and yellow ribbon-like meander containing small floral elements and entrapping large, exotic blossoms.  This pattern goes up one side and down the other.
Along the top and bottom are single botehs reserved in white containing a vase and cypress tree framed by two floral sprays.  These alternate with a small cypress and vase motif with a broken link to a feather-like form.  The botehs point to  the centre and those in the top band face the opposite directions to those in the bottom .
Everything is framed by a series of barrow borders, printed as one block.  These include a repeat of  band [a] edged either side by a small repeating pattern of arch forms and flower heads and cypress trees.
fields.dimensions: Length: 238 cm, Width: 204 cm, Length: 112.5 cm central panel, Width: 121 cm central panel
fields.materials_techniques: cotton yarn, weaving, sewing, resist printing, block printing.
fields.history_note: Purchased for the Museum by Robert Murdoch Smith, from Sidney Churchill in Tehran, this was acquired as a batch of fourteen carpets and carpet fragments and ten specimens of qalamkari printed cotton. Murdoch Smith wrote: "Among the articles are a number of carpets and pieces of carpets of the 17th century and earlier date (some as early as the end of the 15th century or beginning of the 16th century) which will, I think, form a valuable addition to the Museum collection. Some of the best specimens - small pieces, not whole carpets - were got from the rufuqir or darners of worn and torn carpets in the Teheran bazaar."
